articles.author: Sinead Cruise, Lawrence White
articles.description: Barclays (BARC.L) is working on plans to save as much as 1 billion pounds ($1.25 billion), which could involve cutting as many as 2,000 jobs, mainly in the British bank's back office, a person with direct knowledge of the proposals told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Barclays working on $1.25 billion cost plan, could cut up to 2,000 jobs -source

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's Zhongzhi Enterprise Group told investors it is heavily insolvent with liabilities of up to $64 billion, more than double its assets, as one of the country's leading wealth managers grapples with a deepening property sector crisis.
articles.title: China wealth manager Zhongzhi flags insolvency, liabilities of $64 bln

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German trade union Verdi has called on members to go on strike at five Amazon (AMZN.O) distribution centres across Germany on Black Friday, it said in a statement on Thursday.
articles.title: German union Verdi calls for strikes at Amazon on Black Friday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Novo Nordisk plans to invest more than 16 billion Danish crowns ($2.34 billion) to boost production of its weight-loss drugs at a site in Chartres, France, scrambling to keep up with soaring demand.
articles.title: Novo Nordisk invests $2.3 million in France to boost obesity drug production

articles.author: Marc Jones
articles.description: World equity markets added to their best month since the COVID vaccine breakthroughs of late 2020 on Thursday as Europe digested another far-right election shock and oil skidded after OPEC+ postponed its weekend meeting.
articles.title: Stocks maintain November reign, oil nagged by OPEC doubts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's financial firms may be well capitalised now but face challenges ranging from rising interest expenditure and weak loan demand to unrealised losses, Bundesbank Vice President Claudia Buch said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Germany financial sector facing dark clouds, Bundesbank warns

articles.author: Foo Yun Chee
articles.description: Businesses and tech groups on Thursday warned the European Union against over-regulating artificial intelligence systems known as foundation models in upcoming AI rules as this could kill nascent start-ups or drive them out of the region.
articles.title: Businesses, tech groups warn EU against over-regulating AI foundation models

articles.author: Bassam Masoud, Emily Rose
articles.description: The release of hostages under a temporary truce between Israel and Palestinian Hamas militants will not happen before Friday, Israel's national security adviser said, thwarting hopes of relatives that some would be freed on Thursday.
articles.title: No Gaza hostage release will start before Friday, says Israel

articles.author: Anna Tong, Jeffrey Dastin, Krystal Hu
articles.description: Ahead of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman’s four days in exile, several staff researchers sent the board of directors a letter warning of a powerful artificial intelligence discovery that they said could threaten humanity, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Sam Altman's ouster at OpenAI was precipitated by letter to board about AI breakthrough -sources

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: Leading scientists urged caution over fears of another pandemic on Thursday after the World Health Organization requested more information from China on a rise of respiratory illnesses and pneumonia clusters among children.
articles.title: Don't press 'pandemic panic button' scientists caution on China pneumonia report
